channel.title: Error Connecting To Server
channel.description:
317 - Delta Source.
Nothing seems to be working when changing IP's
Other sources you change Client.java and Gui.java and it works.
How do I set it up to the IP so it works on my no-ip adress
If you could help I would be most thankful

item.title: Error Connecting To Server
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:3, topic:355141”][quote author=s p i d a z link=topic=451707.msg3310507#msg3310507 date=1281941355]
change on the client, from 127.0.0.1 or w/e it is to blahblah.no-ip.org
[/quote]

He is saying that he already did that and he is getting this error. Please know what your talking about before you post or at least read it more carefully.

On topic: Post your Compiler… Your compiler could be messing up…[/quote]
Stop being a smart ass.

WicKeRy, instead of putting in your no-ip, try putting in your IP address in gui.java and compile, then see if it works.

Some clients have a bug:

If you are hosting the server and in the GUI.java you put your ip address or a no-ip, it won’t connect, you have to put “localHost” or “127.0.0.1”.

Test your client on another server with the GUI having your server in it (the no-ip) and see if it works.

If that’s the case, then keep a client for yourself, and a release client, and when you release the client, change the GUI to your no-ip.

Read full topic
